description: Inherited from Middle English wisenen, from Old English wisnian, weosnian, from Proto-Germanic *wisnōjaną. Cognate with Icelandic visna.

adjectives.description: wizened (comparative more wizened, superlative most wizened)

entries.meaning: Withered; lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness.
examples: "Ill-fard, crazy, crack-brained gowk, that she is!" exclaimed the housekeeper. . . "If it hadna been that I am mair than half a gentlewoman by my station, I wad hae tried my ten nails in the wizen'd hide o' her!"

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of wizen
